full_content: Leading U.S. law firm Buchalter has selected 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite, as its foundational technology platform for the future. Founded in 1933, Buchalter is a full-service business law firm representing local, regional, national, and international clients in a multitude of practice areas and their subspecialties, among them: Bank and Finance, Corporate, Health Care, Litigation, Insolvency and Financial Law, Intellectual Property, Labor and Employment, Real Estate, and Tax and Estate Planning. Buchalter has more than 500 attorneys with offices in California, Arizona, Colorado, Georgia, Oregon, Tennessee, Utah, and Washington. The firm set a goal to replace its existing practice management platform with a future-proof solution which would offer it both enhanced capabilities and greater flexibility facilitating the firm’s growth. By moving to the cloud with 3E, Buchalter will gain new, market-leading functionality, including advanced analytics and real-time reporting that provides greater insight and visibility than ever before. In addition, the use of Elite’s fully integrated time recording solution, which provides passive time capture through Always-on Time capabilities, will help Buchalter streamline its time-keeping process. Taken together, the new capabilities available within 3E will enable the firm to boost efficiency and improve profitability. More widely, the firm will be supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform. Offering nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry, 3E in the cloud also provides automated workflows, automatic upgrades, and quick access to new functionality. Buchalter will also be adopting eBillingHub®, Elite’s market-leading electronic billing solution designed specifically for law firms. Cloud-based and fully integrated with 3E, eBillingHub will enable the firm to transform and significantly streamline its existing billing processes. “As we looked toward the future, it was key that we put in place a best-in-class technology platform at the heart of our firm, upon which we can build as we continue to grow and evolve,” said Jonathan Hawkins, Senior Director of Finance and Administration. “Moving to the cloud with 3E and eBillingHub was the right choice for us and promises to transform how our firm operates. The powerful reporting and analytics capabilities within 3E will provide us with critical data and information, enabling us to move faster, gain efficiency, and provide our clients with an even better experience.” “We look forward to introducing our clients to the 3E and eBillingHub capabilities in the near future,” added Adam Bass, President and Chief Executive Officer of Buchalter.
title: U.S. Law Firm Buchalter Moves to the Cloud with 3E

full_content: Top 200 UK law firm Roythornes has chosen the cloud version of 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite, as the foundational technology platform to support and enable its ambitious future. Founded in 1934, Roythornes is a UK-based regional law firm with five strategically located offices across the Midlands and East Anglia, with a team of more than 170 legal professionals and around 300 staff in total. It offers recognized expertise to commercial and private clients, with a strong focus on food and agriculture, rural estates, renewables, and charities with services including commercial and residential property, planning, litigation, employment, family and private client, personal injury, and debt recovery. To support the firm’s continued growth and evolution, Roythornes needed to take a major step forward in terms of its financial and practice management platform. By choosing the cloud version of 3E, the firm will improve both the efficiency and effectiveness of its financial operations, and be able to rely on a truly best-in-class and future-proof technological foundation for many years to come. The firm will also have better access than ever before to key management information through the deployment of 3E Data Insights, enabling rich interactive reporting that provides timely, valuable information for better and faster decision-making. In addition, the open API architecture of 3E in the cloud will enable seamless interoperability with many of the firm’s other systems and infrastructure, including iManage Cloud. More widely, Roythornes will now be supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform and offering cloud confidence with nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry. “We evaluated the market extensively and found one clear winner in 3E, the single most architecturally advanced and secure financial and practice management platform available for law firms,” said Jonathan Swan, IT Director at Roythornes. “3E in the cloud is not just a lift-and-shift, but a true SaaS offering which was the right fit for our firm’s cloud-first strategy.” "The level of financial information which is easily available in 3E is impressive, and that will enable us to simplify reporting and streamline the process significantly,” added Sam Elkin, Partner and Finance Director at Roythornes. "It was critical for us that we moved to a platform that provided the firm with the most comprehensive functionality available to enable us to run the business effectively, both now and down the road as we continue to scale. Moving to 3E in the cloud gives us that confidence for the future." For its implementation of 3E in the cloud, Roythornes will be supported end-to-end by Elite Premier Delivery Partner Helm360, a leading legal technology provider with more than 700 employees worldwide and decades of experience in implementation of best-of-breed legal technology solutions such as 3E. “From our initial discussions, it was clear that Roythornes is a forward-thinking firm that values collaboration and transparency, which aligns perfectly with our approach,” said Bim Dave, CEO Designate at Helm360. “Their commitment to excellence and innovation resonates deeply with our team. This synergy will lay the foundation for a strong, trusting partnership, ensuring a successful outcome that surpasses expectations."
title: UK Law Firm Roythornes Chooses 3E in the Cloud

full_content: Elite, a leading provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, and Brightflag, the AI-powered e-billing and matter management platform for in-house legal teams, have today launched a new integration which seamlessly connects two of the legal industry’s leading legal invoicing solutions: eBillingHub and Brightflag. eBillingHub from Elite is the pioneering and market-leading electronic billing solution designed specifically for law firms to prepare, submit, track, and manage electronic invoices, and to improve and streamline their billing processes. It is trusted by firms of all sizes across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific. Brightflag’s e-billing and matter management platform provides corporate legal departments with visibility into legal spend and enables them to effectively control costs. The intuitive AI-powered platform makes teams more productive by taking on time-consuming, manual, tasks related to invoicing, reporting, and matter management. The new integration means that law firms can now use eBillingHub to submit invoices directly to in-house teams that use Brightflag. Firms can also use eBillingHub to track the payment status of invoices submitted to Brightflag. “This new integration with Brightflag is the latest demonstration of our commitment to making eBillingHub the most powerful and accessible e-billing platform for law firms,” said Elisabet Hardy, Chief Product Officer at Elite. “Integrations such as this play an important role in helping law firms to significantly reduce the administrative work required for e-billing and to speed up invoice payment, which can be transformative for their cashflow. Working together with the Brightflag team to bring this integration to life has been an excellent collaboration, and our shared dedication to customer success has been clear.” “We are thrilled to launch the integration between Brightflag and eBillingHub,” commented Barry O’Melia, Vice President of Product at Brightflag. “Law firms love Brightflag’s ease of use, excellent customer service, and of course that they’re never charged to use it. This new integration is just another thing for them to love.” Ahad Shafiq, Senior Product Manager at Elite, added, “Customers are describing the new integration between eBillingHub and Brightflag as extremely welcome. Quick status response times, simple and secure setup, embedded regional routing, and enhanced functionality like the differentiation of attachment types are now all able to come together to make this a step in the right direction for the legal billing ecosystem.” --------------------- About Elite For more than seven decades, Elite has been a leading global provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the legal industry. Today, Elite’s platform is the trusted technological foundation for a significant proportion of the world's most successful and innovative law firms. About Brightflag Brightflag's e-billing and matter management platform is the most effective solution for providing visibility into legal spend and controlling costs. The intuitive AI-powered platform makes corporate legal teams more productive by taking on time-consuming, manual, tasks related to invoicing, reporting, and matter management.  The company serves a global community of legal professionals from offices in New York, Ireland, and Australia. Media Contacts Scott Addison or Jackie Hopkins, Infinite Global (for Elite) ElitePR@infiniteglobal.com Sarah Scales, Brightflag sarah.scales@brightflag.com
title: Elite and Brightflag Unveil New Integration to Streamline Legal Invoicing

full_content: NEW YORK (August 19, 2024) – Elite, a leading provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, today announced Elisabet Hardy, currently Head of Product, has been appointed Chief Product Officer, effective immediately, and John Machado has been appointed as its new Chief Technology Officer, effective September 9. Eric Sugden, who assumed the role of Chief Technology Officer in 2023, will remain with the company through the end of September 2024 to ensure a seamless transition. These leadership changes reflect Elite’s continued focus on driving growth and innovation as a SaaS company and providing its customers with industry-leading software solutions that will help law firms increase productivity and profitability as they innovate and transform for the future. “We continue to make significant strides forward in our business growth, driven by the increasing momentum from our customers moving to the cloud and our commitment to innovation and strategic integration of AI capabilities in our cloud-native SaaS platform,” said Mark Dorman, CEO of Elite. “With these new appointments, we’re putting key leaders and capabilities in place to accelerate growth and better serve our customers. Elisabet and John are experienced, accomplished leaders whose combined expertise and depth of knowledge of the legal technology industry and developing and deploying software solutions will allow us to capitalize on the strong cloud foundation that we’ve built. We look forward to welcoming John, and I also want to express my heartfelt thanks to Eric for his leadership and outstanding contributions throughout his career at Elite.” Hardy commented, “I’m excited to build on the success we’ve had as a new SaaS company. As we continue to invest in and expand our core product development capabilities, we are delivering industry-leading solutions that allow our customers to work more efficiently and effectively. With our products that are purpose-built for law firms, we are helping them simplify and automate complex, mundane processes and unlock new ways to manage their business and financial operations.” Machado added, “I'm thrilled to join Elite at this pivotal moment. We're not just building software – we're transforming the legal landscape through technology – and it’s truly inspiring. I'm eager to leverage my experience and our incredible team here at Elite to accelerate the delivery of our cloud-native solutions to empower law firms to harness the power of data, improve operations and achieve new levels of success. I look forward to strengthening our customer relationships, and ensuring we continue to deliver best-in-class solutions that meet the evolving needs of law firms worldwide." Most recently, Machado served as the Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer at UKG, a global leader in developing HR, payroll and workforce management cloud solutions, where he was at the forefront of architecting, developing and deploying cutting-edge solutions for the company. With over two decades of experience, he has consistently driven innovation and excellence in technology.
title: Press Release: Elite Announces Executive Leadership Updates

full_content: Leading U.S. litigation law firm Morrison Mahoney is poised to completely transform its billing processes through the adoption of eBillingHub®, the pioneering electronic billing solution from Elite. Founded in 1948, Morrison Mahoney LLP has more than 170 lawyers working across 11 offices in the United States and United Kingdom, and is recognized as one of the leading litigation firms in the Northeastern U.S. It offers a diverse range of practice areas and specialisms and is particularly renowned for its strength in insurance defense work. The firm is part of global legal network ALFA International and is associated with several leading industry organizations, including the Defense Research Institute, International Association of Defense Counsel, and Federation of Insurance & Corporate Counsel. The firm has been a user of 3E®—Elite’s flagship financial and practice management solution—since 2000, and the ability for any billing solution to integrate seamlessly with 3E was key in the firm’s decision-making process. eBillingHub was the right choice for Morrison Mahoney not only because of its seamless integration with 3E, but also its ability to streamline and simplify the firm’s complex and previously manual billing processes. In particular, the ability to handle large volumes of invoices was critical because of the firm’s significant insurance practice, which required the firm to regularly issue approximately 3,000 e-bills per month. More widely, eBillingHub will enable the firm to prepare, submit, track, and manage all its electronic invoices in a single web-based, user-friendly e-billing application. Highly flexible and scalable, eBillingHub also offers powerful out-of-the-box reporting and analytics which provide easy-to-read graphical reports and robust tools to better understand any billing issues and improve firm cashflow. In fact, customers using eBillingHub generally see their write-offs and write downs reduce by 50%, as well as an increase in average invoice payment time of 14 days. “Implementing eBillingHub within our firm will play a key role in streamlining and simplifying our entire billing process, enabling us to reduce our write-offs and speed up our cash flow,” said Marlene​​​​ Morris, Director of Finance at Morrison Mahoney. “In addition, the integration between eBillingHub and 3E was an important factor in our decision, ensuring seamless connectivity between our billing and financial management solutions.”
title: Morrison Mahoney to Transform Billing Processes with eBillingHub

full_content: Leading U.S. law firm Greenspoon Marder furthers its commitment to the cloud through its continued integration of 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite. Founded in 1981, Greenspoon Marder LLP is a full-service law firm with over 225 lawyers and more than 20 office locations across the United States. With strength in real estate, litigation, and transactional services, the firm provides comprehensive and tailored client services, serving Fortune 500, middle-market public and private companies, start-ups, emerging businesses, individuals, and entrepreneurs around the world. The firm has used the on-prem version of 3E since 2011 and is looking forward to the increased capabilities and efficiencies this shift will provide. Of strategic importance to Greenspoon Marder in their choice of 3E in the cloud was the ability to benefit from automatic upgrades and quick access to new functionality, as well as automated workflows, real-time insights, and advanced analytics. More widely, the firm will now be supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform and offering nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry. The firm will also be transforming its billing processes through the adoption of eBillingHub, the market-leading electronic billing solution designed specifically for law firms. Fully integrated with 3E, eBillingHub enables firms to seamlessly prepare, submit, track, and manage electronic invoices. In addition, Greenspoon Marder will be deploying 3E Data Insights, which provides powerful analytics and real-time dashboards that can incorporate data from third-party sources and solutions in order to facilitate faster and better decision-making. "We see substantial value in leveraging 3E in the cloud, with its continuous enhancements, fixes and updates that don’t require full system upgrades. These tools not only streamline our operations but also empower us to deliver even more efficient and tailored client services," said Jen Fante, COO/CFO of Greenspoon Marder. “The foundations of our business have been on 3E for some time now, so when we looked toward the future and making a move to the cloud, doing so with 3E was a natural next step,” said Bill Riley, CTO of Greenspoon Marder. “The safety of our clients’ data is an absolute priority and the advanced data security and market-leading cyber protection 3E provides played a significant role in our decision.”
title: Am Law 200 Firm Greenspoon Marder Moves to the Cloud with 3E and eBillingHub

full_content: NEW YORK (August 1, 2024) – Elite, a leading provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, today announced Steve Payne has been appointed as its new Chief Revenue Officer. Payne will lead the company’s global Sales team, as well as business development, solution consulting and sales operations, and focus on driving Elite’s growth by expanding market share with new customers and further developing relationships with existing customers. Before Elite, Payne most recently worked with Comcast SportsTech and Boomtown Accelerators as an Executive Advisor to multiple investment partners and technology start-up companies. Prior to that, he spent 17 years at MediaKind (previously Ericsson Media Solutions and Tandberg Television), and he served as President and Chief Revenue Officer in his last four years with the company. During his time there, he led the company through various phases of acquisition and divestitures, while also driving a significant cloud transformation. “As a cloud-native, SaaS company, Elite is rapidly transforming the legal technology industry, and we are leading our customers through a period of significant change,” said Mark Dorman, CEO of Elite. “Steve’s proven leadership and deep experience forging new customer relationships, while strengthening existing ones, will be essential to accelerating our growth strategy and delivering increased value to our customers, the world’s leading law firms.” Payne added, “Elite is a visionary company working with law firms of all sizes who are focused on leveraging the cloud to improve operational efficiency, increase security, enhance decision-making and improve profitability. The opportunities for growth and innovation are immense, and I am excited to join Elite at this critical time.”
title: Press Release: Elite Welcomes Steve Payne as New Chief Revenue Officer

full_content: Leading global law firm Clyde & Co will be moving its core financial and practice management systems to the cloud through its selection of 3E®, the market-leading solution from Elite. Founded in 1933, Clyde & Co is a leading, globally integrated law firm, specializing in key sectors which underpin global trade and commercial activity such as insurance, transport, infrastructure, energy, and trade and commodities. With more than 3,200 legal professionals—including 492 partners and more than 2,700 lawyers—working across 60+ offices on 6 continents, it offers a comprehensive range of contentious and non-contentious legal services and commercially-minded legal advice to businesses operating across developed and developing markets. Clyde & Co has been an on-prem 3E customer since 2016. As the firm looked ahead, it wanted to ensure it had the best available solution to meet the evolving needs of its legal and financial operations. After a competitive selection process, the firm chose the cloud version of 3E, an already well known and trusted solution. By moving to the cloud version of 3E, Clyde & Co will benefit from automatic upgrades and quick access to new functionality, as well as automated workflows, on-line billing, real-time insights, and advanced analytics. Clyde & Co will now be supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform and offering nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry. 3E in the cloud will also play a key role in underpinning a wider transformation of how the entire firm operates, including through seamless API-powered integrations with other systems and tools across the firm which enable robust connectivity with the Microsoft Power Platform®. This transformation will also be supported by the deployment of 3E Data Insights, providing powerful analytics and real-time dashboards which can incorporate data from third-party sources and solutions and facilitate faster and better decision-making. In addition, the firm will be evolving and enhancing its billing processes through expanded use of eBillingHub, Elite's market-leading electronic billing solution designed specifically for law firms. Longer term, the firm will also integrate 3E Proforma to further enhance the billing process.
title: Global Top 100 Firm Clyde & Co Moves to the Cloud with 3E

full_content: Source Consulting Group has joined Elite’s Premier Delivery Partner program, becoming the third partner organization to join the program since its launch. The Premier Delivery Partner Program, which was first announced at VANTAGE London in March 2024, enables customers to work directly with a small number of service partners on their full cloud implementation and other post-implementation needs for 3E®. Chicago-based Source Consulting Group is a long-time services partner of Elite, having helped deliver many successful 3E implementations over the last 12 years. Its consultative approach to its implementation sets them apart from the tactile standards common in the industry. With consultants that have decades of experience helping clients optimize their investments in technology, they are known for expertly handling the full range of system implementation services, including leveraging 3E to automate outdated processes. Source Consulting Group works with clients ranging from Am Law 100 to mid-sized regional firms and offers certified experts in Elite applications and for migrating to 3E in the cloud. “We are looking forward to the synergies that our enhanced relationship with Elite can bring and to providing top-notch implementation support for customers who are making the move to the cloud with 3E,” added Sonnie Yoon, Managing Director of Source Consulting Group. Source Consulting Group joins two other leading technology services organizations—Harbor Global and Helm360—as members of the Premier Delivery Partner Program, both of which have a proven track record of delivery and offer the capabilities and capacity to scale quickly on a global basis in response to customer needs. “When the Premier Delivery Partner Program was launched earlier this year, we indicated that we would grow the network to support delivery of our SaaS solution,” said Martin Linusson, Chief Customer Officer at Elite. “With a great track record of delivery with Elite and an excellent reputation in the market, Source Consulting Group is a stellar addition to the program.” In addition to the Premier Delivery Partner Program, Elite’s broader partner program includes more than 60 technology and service providers offering essential specialties and expertise in specific products, skill sets, or geographic regions to meet a range of customer needs and support requirements.
title: Source Consulting Group Becomes Elite Premier Delivery Partner

full_content: Fast-growing U.S. law firm Elias Law Group has gone live on the cloud version of 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite, providing a powerful foundational technology platform to support its future. Founded in 2021, Elias Law Group is the largest law firm in the U.S. focused on representing the Democratic Party, Democratic campaigns, nonprofit organizations, and individuals “committed to securing a progressive future.” Its lawyers have collectively represented hundreds of Democratic campaigns, organizations, and PACs—including every national Democratic Party organization, House and Senate leadership, governors, senators, and members of Congress, as well as more than a dozen presidential campaigns. The firm’s 110-strong team is based across two offices in Washington, D.C. and Seattle. On the back of a period of exceptional growth and expansion, Elias Law Group sought to consolidate and upgrade its systems and infrastructure to move its business to the next level. By adopting 3E in the cloud, the firm has gained robust, out-of-the-box functionality, including automated workflows, real-time insights, and advanced analytics to improve profitability and boost efficiency. It will also benefit from automatic upgrades and quick access to new functionality, thanks to a fully managed service provided by Elite. Powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform, 3E in the cloud also offers nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry.
title: Elias Law Group Goes Live on 3E in the Cloud, Underpinning the Next Stage of Growth

full_content: Leading Australian law firm Macpherson Kelley has taken the final step on its migration to the cloud by selecting 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite. Founded in 1905, Macpherson Kelley is a full-service commercial law firm with offices in Brisbane, Dandenong, Melbourne, and Sydney. The firm has more than 140 lawyers across 20 different legal areas and a total team of 250, with a firm-wide focus on client experience and providing “law fit for business.” The firm is also affiliated with Multilaw and the Pacific Legal Network, two major international legal networks. Macpherson Kelley has reached the final step in its wider transition into the cloud across the firm, a journey it began in 2019. A 3E on-prem customer since 2010 the firm will now gain even greater efficiencies by moving to the cloud-native version of 3E, as well as benefit from increased flexibility, robust capabilities, and faster upgrades and access to new functionality. The firm will be able to remove or automate manual processes, gain real-time insights, and make use of advanced analytics to improve efficiency and decision-making, all while keeping most of their existing 3E customizations as part of the implementation. Going forward, Macpherson Kelley will be supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform and offering cloud confidence with nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry. “The move to the cloud version of 3E, and being a 100% cloud-based organization, will enable us to be more agile as the firm grows and enable us to focus on more business enabling initiatives versus operational activities,” said Andrew Mitchell, Chief Information Office at Macpherson Kelley. “We have used 3E for years, and it was the obvious choice to provide a robust, open, cloud-based platform while keeping most of our existing customizations. Making the transition to 3E in the cloud also won’t require a substantial change management program, given our familiarity with the platform, which is a huge bonus.”
title: Australian Law Firm Macpherson Kelley Completes Cloud Journey with 3E

full_content: Elite has launched a new AI-powered mobile app for the cloud version of 3E. The 3E mobile app, available for both iOS and Android, sets the foundation for bringing the power of the entire 3E® cloud portfolio to our customers, wherever they happen to be. The 3E app leverages a new Microsoft Azure security framework that relies on Front Door and Entra to provide seamless authentication and easy deployment options, allowing firms to comfortably deliver the mobile experience to their timekeepers regardless of location. The first iteration of the 3E app focuses on Time Entry, dramatically simplifying the process for busy professionals. Users of the new app will immediately benefit from: - Device-native AI enhanced dictation, grammar and spellcheck features that allow users to dictate narratives and perform searches of drop-down lists and matters - Improved calendar control that provides totals by day, week, or month, enabling a review of time by the desired period and easier editing and posting - A new auto-save function which ensures that edits are saved as they are made - An enhanced, faster loading experience that reduces wait times for matter, phase, task, and activity lists And Time Entry is just the beginning. Upcoming enhancements include better assistant (Siri) integration to allow users to start a timer or enter time from their home screen, the ability to display running timer banners on their phone and smart watch, and enhanced voice control within the application. The future 3E mobile experience will enable our customers to work seamlessly across devices, regardless of where a process or information source was started or resides. The new 3E mobile app is now available for download from the Apple and Android app stores.
title: Elite Launches New Mobile App for 3E Cloud Time Entry

full_content: Elite has announced new partnerships with cosine and Zylinc which further extend the capabilities of its flagship financial and practice management solution 3E®. These new partnerships provide the latest evidence of the flexibility, power, and potential of 3E’s open SaaS platform. Elite’s long-standing technology and implementation partnership with cosine solutions has expanded to enable cosine Matter Planning in the cloud. On-prem 3E customers using cosine Matter Planning will be able to move seamlessly to the cloud with the combined solution intact, and new cloud customers will be able to integrate cosine into their 3E solution as part of their implementation. In addition, further cosine modules will be made available later this year (Q4 2024) to 3E cloud customers as part of this expanded partnership. “Building on 3E’s powerful and flexible SaaS platform, cosine’s robust feature set and easy-to-use interface have been key to supporting our customers’ matter planning and pricing strategy, driving operational efficiency in this critical part of modern legal operations” said Lucas Garlepp, Chief Operating Officer at cosine. “3E cloud customers will soon be able to benefit from cosine Matter Planning in the cloud, and we are looking forward to rolling out further cloud-based modules later this year, extending the 3E experience.” In addition, the new partnership with passive time capture software provider Zylinc enables 3E cloud users to have seamless connectivity with Zylinc’s technology solution, which provide automatic and accurate capturing of incoming and outgoing phone calls across mobile phones and landlines. Through a new API-powered integration, call-related time and billing information from Zylinc can be logged directly into 3E by automatically matching calls with contact details from existing databases, associating the call with the specific client name and matter. Users also benefit from powerful privacy controls and options, including robust data encryption. “Being able to offer our capabilities to 3E cloud customers in a now fully integrated way will be of tangible benefit to users of both of our solutions,” said Kristine Andersen, Chief Revenue Officer at Zylinc. “Our solution is the only one of its kind on the market and plays an important role in helping busy professionals focus on what they are great at, freeing up valuable time and increasing billable hours.” Cosine and Zylinc are both members of Elite’s partner program, which consists of more than 60 technology and service providers offering essential specialisms and expertise in specific products, skill sets, or geographic regions to meet a range of customer needs and support requirements. “We are always looking for new ways to extend and flex our solutions to meet the needs of customers, and the open platform architecture which sits at the core of 3E enables such innovative solutions to be developed,” added Elisabet Hardy, Head of Product at Elite. “It is great to welcome Zylinc to our partner ecosystem as well as expand our existing partnership with cosine, in order to provide an even more seamless experience to our 3E customers.”
title: New Cosine and Zylinc Partnerships Embody the Power of the 3E SaaS Open Platform

full_content: Leading U.S. law firm Gentry Locke has successfully moved its financial and business operations into the cloud with 3E® , the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite. Established more than a century ago, Gentry Locke is now the eighth largest law firm in the state of Virginia, with an 83-strong team of lawyers practicing across a range of disciplines. From its offices in Roanoke, Lynchburg, Richmond, and Norfolk, the firm helps companies, institutions, organizations, and individuals meet their legal and business challenges. In addition, the firm is affiliated with ALFA International, a legal network of more than 10,000 lawyers in 140 law firms throughout the United States and in Europe, Asia, Africa, and Australia. The firm’s solid growth trajectory in recent years had made largely manual and paper-driven processes and systems for managing its business unsustainable over the longer term. As a result, the firm selected the cloud version of 3E to enable the power of automation to transform its workflows and eliminate manual reporting. With 3E in the cloud, it has gained significant efficiencies by removing or automating manual processes, including in areas like proformas and invoicing. Thanks to the deployment of 3E, proformas are now generated, edited, and processed for invoicing significantly faster, and on a largely automated basis, which in turn will speed up the firm’s work-to-cash cycle. More widely, Gentry Locke is now supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft Azure® platform and offering cloud confidence with nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry. "Moving our business into the cloud with 3E has been a major step forward for our firm, and it is already proving transformative for us,” said Frank Pittard, Executive Director at Gentry Locke. “We needed to modernize both our systems and our processes to eliminate or automate the largely manual ways of doing things. Investing in powerful technology like 3E is enabling us to better serve our clients and empowering our firm to be more efficient, productive, and profitable.” In addition, Gentry Locke has also deployed other Elite solutions which seamlessly integrate with the cloud version of 3E. These include Advanced Financial Solutions—a Microsoft® Excel® toolset with powerful reporting capabilities on productivity, efficiency, and profitability—and eBillingHub®, Elite’s market-leading electronic billing solution designed specifically for law firms.
title: Gentry Locke Goes Live in the Cloud with 3E

full_content: Within weeks after its launch, the highly streamlined version of Elite’s flagship financial management and business operations solution—3E® Essentials™—already has a number of firms around the globe in the process of, or shortly due to begin, a rapid implementation and go live on the platform in the weeks ahead. These firms include: - U.S. law firm Dinse P.C., a Vermont-based firm serving businesses, institutions, and individuals, and one of the oldest and largest law firms in the state - Lamson Dugan & Murray LLP, a 45-lawyer firm based in Omaha, Nebraska, and Des Moines, Iowa, which has a heavy focus on both litigation and corporate law - Borgelt, Powell, Peterson & Frauen, S.C, a Milwaukee, Wisconsin-based firm founded in 1881, with 20 lawyers which concentrates primarily in the defense of civil litigation - Duggan Bertsch LLC, a Chicago-headquartered law firm with an 85-strong team dedicated to thoughtful, innovative, and uncompromising legal representation for the private client, focusing on business & corporate, trust & estates, real estate, and litigation - Figari + Davenport, LLP, founded in 1986 as one of the first commercial litigation boutiques in Dallas and which is known for its handling of complex, cutting-edge civil litigation in Texas and across the United States “As we considered our options to migrate from Elite Enterprise, the easy-to-use interface and superior functionality made 3E Essentials the right choice for us,” said Allan Hernandez, IT Director at Figari + Davenport. “Moving our firm to the cloud is an important step in modernizing our business, and 3E Essentials promises to provide our firm with a robust technological foundation which will be quick and easy to deploy.” Firms choosing 3E Essentials will have in place preset configurations based on a self-service questionnaire and best practices, enabling rapid implementation of many 3E standard capabilities and functionality. From the first day of deployment, firms using 3E Essentials can access powerful financial management features and benefit from cloud scalability and automatic software upgrades. Built on the market-leading Microsoft® Azure® platform, 3E Essentials also provides state-of-the-art physical and digital protection of firm data, with security practices and processes protected by top security measures, including data isolation, data encryption, inter-process communication, access control, and secure coding and testing.
title: 3E Essentials Takes the Market by Storm

full_content: Leading Scottish law firm Morton Fraser MacRoberts (MFMac) has chosen the cloud version of 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite, as its technology foundation for the future. One of the ‘Big Four’ Scottish independent law firms, MFMac employs more than 480 people across its offices in Edinburgh and Glasgow, including more than 250 lawyers and 78 partners. MFMac offers practical legal advice for businesses, the public sector, charities, individuals, and families, and it counts many well-known companies, government and public sector organizations, and high-profile individuals among its clients. With roots going back more than 400 years, the firm is the result of a recent merger of two of the longest established and most prestigious firms in Scotland. Post-merger, MFMac undertook a thorough review and selection process for many of its key technology solutions against the evolved needs, scale, and ambitions of the combined firm. As a result, 3E was selected as the firm’s core financial and practice management platform, providing the firm with a user-friendly, efficient, and agile technological foundation to support its next chapter. By choosing the cloud version of 3E, MFMac will benefit from maximum flexibility as well as best-in-class security and reliability going forward. Built on the market-leading Microsoft® Azure® platform, 3E in the cloud provides state-of-the-art physical and digital protection of firm data with security practices and processes protected by top security measures, including data isolation, data encryption, inter-process communication, access control, and secure coding and testing. In addition, the firm is deploying 3E Data Insights, which will provide greater insight into its business operations and performance than ever before, with powerful analytics and reporting that enables instant, graphic reports to facilitate faster decision-making. “As we emerged from the recent merger of our two firms, it was very important to ensure we had the right technological foundations to help drive our combined business forward and empower our team to focus on remaining at the cutting edge of client service excellence,” said Neil Kennedy, Chief Operating Officer at MFMac. “3E in the cloud was the right choice for our future, not least because of its market-leading security and reliability, but also because it will provide us with the most flexibility as we continue to grow and evolve.”
title: Scottish Law Firm Morton Fraser MacRoberts Moves Forward with 3E in the Cloud

full_content: Australian law firm Colin Biggers & Paisley has selected 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite, as the final step on its journey to the cloud. Established in 1900, Colin Biggers & Paisley is a substantial national legal practice with more than 500 employees. It is particularly renowned for its insurance, property, and construction experience and has significant expertise in transactions, projects, infrastructure, commercial advisory, and dispute resolution. The practice has been a 3E on-prem customer since 2014, underscoring a clear commitment to excellence in client service by using technology and innovation to optimize its business operations. With 3E in the cloud, it will gain significant efficiencies by removing or automating manual processes, and be able to leverage powerful synergies when it comes to the firm’s use of the Microsoft® Power Platform. Going forward, Colin Biggers & Paisley will be supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft Azure® platform and offering cloud confidence with nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry. "We made the strategic decision to move to the cloud version of 3E to take advantage of the numerous benefits the platform offers,” said Sam Sofianos, Chief Information Officer at Colin Biggers & Paisley. “Moving to the cloud provides increased scalability, flexibility, and security and allows us to take advantage of the latest technological advancements and improve operational efficiency. It also enhances our application security and offers best-of-breed cyber protection. Adopting 3E in the cloud will play a key role in future-proofing our firm from a cybersecurity, data, and reporting perspective." “Moving to the cloud version of 3E aligns with our strategic goal to leverage technology for enhanced operational efficiency,” added Jiyoung Park, Colin Biggers & Paisley's Chief Financial Officer. “We are looking forward to a streamlined and user-friendly workflow system, which promises to save valuable time for our lawyers and support personnel.”
title: Australian Law Firm Colin Biggers & Paisley Embraces Cloud with 3E

full_content: NEW YORK (May 6, 2024) – Elite, a leading provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, today announced it has appointed Stephanie Milikh as its new Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary. Milikh will be responsible for leading the company’s legal and risk management strategy, while overseeing its legal, compliance and security functions. Previously, she was General Counsel at Discovery Education, a worldwide edtech leader, where she led the legal and compliance teams. Milikh took up that role following the acquisition of Discovery Education by a leading private equity firm. Prior to that, she served as Director, Legal Affairs for Warner Bros. Discovery. Earlier in her career, Milikh held roles at Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison in New York City and Baker Botts in Washington D.C. “We are at a pivotal stage in our growth journey as a SaaS company, and we are delighted to welcome Stephanie to Elite,” said Mark Dorman, CEO of Elite. “Stephanie’s proven success and experience working in a SaaS environment will be critical as we continue to expand our services and drive our future growth. Her in-depth expertise and customer-focused approach will be valuable assets to our own teams and our customers.” Milikh commented, “I am excited to join Elite during a time of rapid transformation and growth. I look forward to working with the team as the company continues to scale its cloud-based capabilities and bring its business vision to life.”
title: Press Release: Elite Appoints New Chief Legal Officer and Corporate Secretary

full_content: Am Law 200 law firm Sullivan & Worcester is moving from the on-prem to cloud version of 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite, to support its ambitions for the future. First established more than eight decades ago, Sullivan & Worcester is a global law firm with approximately 200 lawyers working from its offices in Boston, London, New York, Tel Aviv, and Washington, D.C. The firm’s clients—which include several Fortune 500 companies, leading financial services firms and asset managers, boards of directors, and emerging businesses—rely on Sullivan’s ability to navigate complex legal and operational landscapes, the impeccable judgment of its lawyers, and its commitment to best-in-class client service. The firm wanted to maintain the power and agility of the 3E platform but also benefit from the market-leading security and enhanced flexibility which is offered by the cloud. Now, the firm will have greater insight into its business operations and performance, even more tangible productivity gains and ROI, and security and reliability which lead the industry. More specifically, 3E in the cloud—which is built on the market-leading Microsoft® Azure® platform—provides state-of-the-art physical and digital protection of firm data with security practices and processes protected by top security measures, including data isolation, data encryption, inter-process communication, access control, and secure coding and testing. “3E has been a core technology foundation for our financial and business operations for many years, and we appreciate the role it has played in helping our firm to move forward,” says Geoff Matherson, Chief Financial Officer at Sullivan & Worcester. “Moving to a fully cloud-based model of 3E absolutely was the natural next step for us as we continue to grow and evolve.”

full_content: Katchr has announced a new partnership with Elite, a leading provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, which will provide 3E and ProLaw clients with access to Katchr’s industry-leading law firm BI portfolio. With more than 30 years’ experience, Katchr specializes solely in developing and supporting enterprise-class BI solutions in the law firm mid-market, a key segment of Elite’s client base. “Our BI portfolio is specifically tailored to meet the needs of law firms and aid their strategic growth,” stated Graham Moore, Managing Director of Katchr. “While we already work with a number of Elite clients, this partnership will open the benefits of the Katchr platform to a wider audience.” “Our hosted platform leverages the wealth of information stored in 3E and ProLaw, and provides this in a digestible, timely dashboard environment,” Moore continued. “Access to these key metrics and critical business information in an intuitive format is critical to the success of today’s law firm.” “Katchr is an established BI solutions provider with our mid-tier law firm clients,” added Elisabet Hardy, Head of Product at Elite. “Being a primary law firm PMS in many jurisdictions, the addition of Katchr to our partner eco-system was an obvious choice, as our clients are continually looking for best-in-class complimentary solutions to both 3E and ProLaw.” “Alongside our portfolio of solutions, Katchr clients also have access to the specialist expertise, strategic advice and guidance that the Katchr team provide, ensuring that their strategic goals are met in the short, medium and longer term,” Moore added. “A closer relationship with Elite will only enhance our capabilities to serve our mutual clients even better.” About Katchr The Katchr solution is performance management and business analytics dashboard software and is currently used to support and drive change in over 100 law firms and 7000 fee earners. Katchr has been developed with and for law firms and ensures that the data they have locked away is turned into actionable information for every member of the team at the touch of a button. With proven integrations to most leading case and practice management systems, Katchr dashboards monitor all aspects of law firm performance including fee earner KPIs, marketing, case progress, risk and compliance, client-matter profitability and departmental P&L. Fully compatible with a smart phone and tablet, Katchr dashboard visualisations and reports can be tailored to each firm and help optimise every aspect of their business operations, marketing and pricing decisions.
title: Elite to Help Clients Unlock Katchr’s BI Portfolio

full_content: Leading New Zealand law firm MinterEllisonRuddWatts has chosen 3E®, the market-leading financial and practice management solution from Elite, as its cloud-based technology foundation for the future. full_content: London law firm Forsters has selected the market-leading financial and practice management solution 3E® from Elite as a foundational technology component of its wider ”true cloud” SaaS strategy. In addition, the firm is poised to adapt its billing processes through the adoption of eBillingHub®, the world’s leading e-billing solution for law firms. Forsters, a leading UK law firm, has a team of more than 300 lawyers and 500 professionals across multiple practice areas. In selecting 3E, Forsters wanted to develop its technological foundation and operational efficiency. The functionality of 3E is well suited to handle the firm’s needs. "It was clear to us that 3E is a functionally rich finance solution, with standard functionality in the cloud that wouldn’t require bespoke development or customisation,” said Aamir Shaheen, Head of Finance at Forsters. Crucially, the true cloud architecture which 3E offers was aligned with the firm’s overall cloud strategy, enabling interoperability with other systems and tools through open APIs. In addition, the connectivity with the Microsoft® Power Platform® will enable the firm to build powerful, bespoke PowerApps. "3E in the cloud is one of the very few true SaaS financial and practice management solutions applicable to law firms of our size and complexity,” said Anthony Stables, CIO at Forsters. “Cloud solutions should be able to work seamlessly with each other, and the 3E APIs and integration capabilities give us the confidence that we can develop true end-to-end automation capabilities as we move forward.” Data security was also a key factor in the firm’s decision to move to 3E. “Security is key for law firms when partnering with any cloud provider, and we feel confident that Elite is the best guardian of our clients’ data,” said Stables. Forsters will also benefit from faster, automatic upgrades which come from choosing 3E in the cloud. As well as moving to 3E, Forsters will be adopting Elite’s electronic billing solution eBillingHub, an intuitive, web-based platform which will enable an overhaul of the firm’s current approach to billing. Once implemented, all the firm’s e-bills will be managed through a single, easy-to-use interface which is integrated with 3E. The result will be streamlined billing processes, reduced time to payment and faster cash collection.
title: London Law Firm Forsters Chooses 3E and eBillingHub

full_content: LONDON and NEW YORK (March 6, 2024) – Elite, a leading provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, today launched its Premier Delivery Partner Program, which will enable customers to work directly with two initial Premier Delivery services partners on end-to-end implementations of Elite’s 3E cloud solution. The new program was unveiled at Elite’s VANTAGE London Conference, the first of three major customer events taking place in 2024. Two of the industry’s leading technology services organizations – Harbor and Helm360 – have joined the newly created Premier Delivery Partner Program. Both organizations have a proven track record of delivery and offer the capabilities and capacity to scale quickly on a global basis in response to customer needs. As an evolution of Elite’s strategy to deliver its leading, cloud-native financial and practice management platform, customers now can work directly with the service partner on their full cloud implementation and other post-implementation needs. Additionally, Elite will support its Premier Delivery partners to ensure successful delivery of its 3E cloud solution. Martin Linusson, Chief Customer Officer, Elite, stated, “Elite’s partners have long played a central role in meeting customer needs, and our new Premier Delivery Partner Program takes our partner approach to the next level. Our customers can now engage directly with a single partner services team throughout their entire implementation, resulting in a more streamlined, seamless and practical implementation experience. Within our broader partner ecosystem, we aim to support and enable all partners who wish to extend their capability to successfully deliver our solution, and we believe our customers benefit from being able to choose which company best suits their delivery needs.” Norm Mullock, Global Head of Corporate Development and Alliances, Harbor, said, “Migrating to the cloud requires a specialized approach and skills. Harbor provides end-to-end services that enable thoughtful planning and execution – assessing business and technology requirements, identifying the best strategy, executing on the project, and providing ongoing support and services. Our team of 70+ Elite experts has a proven track record of working with Elite’s technology and delivering successful client outcomes. We’re delighted to elevate our partnership further with Elite to deliver the benefits of cloud to 3E clients globally.” Bim Dave, Executive Vice President, Helm360, commented, "We're excited to be part of Elite's Premier Delivery Partner Program. This program allows us to leverage our global reach and expertise in implementing Elite’s 3E cloud solution and delivering exceptional value to its customers. Helm360's proven track record in cloud deployments, combined with Elite's innovative technology, will ensure a seamless and successful experience for Elite’s customers, regardless of their location." Over time, the Premier Delivery Partner Program will expand to incorporate additional service partners in response to customer needs. In addition, Elite’s broader partner program remains unchanged, with more than 60 technology and service providers offering essential specialisms and expertise in specific products, skill sets, or geographic regions to meet a range of customer needs and support requirements.
title: Press Release: Elite Launches Premier Delivery Partner Program

full_content: Elite, a leading provider of financial and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, today announced the launch of 3E® Essentials™, a highly streamlined version of its cloud-based financial and practice management solution. Adopting a new services-based implementation model for 3E, 3E Essentials enables a faster and more efficient deployment than ever before. In as little as 16 weeks, firms choosing 3E Essentials will have in place preset configurations based on a self-service questionnaire and best practices, enabling rapid deployment of many 3E standard capabilities and functionality. These include billing, budgeting, reporting, and time management, as well as multiple templates in areas such as proformas and invoicing. Additional capabilities are available post-implementation for firms which seek to expand and evolve their use of 3E across their business over time, including profitability analysis or other integrations via APIs. From the first day of deployment, firms using 3E Essentials can access powerful financial management features and benefit from cloud scalability and automatic software upgrades. The implementation approach is standardized around a preset configuration, in addition to robust self-service e-learning through in-app guides, videos and documentation. Built on the market-leading Microsoft® Azure® platform, 3E Essentials also provides state-of-the-art physical and digital protection of firm data, with security practices and processes protected by top security measures, including data isolation, data encryption, inter-process communication, access control, and secure coding and testing. “3E Essentials is aimed at firms which have fewer in-house IT resources, but which still want to harness the power of the transformational technology and efficiencies available within 3E,” said Elisabet Hardy, head of product at Elite. “The availability of 3E Essentials is just the latest demonstration of how we are innovating to help our customers be more profitable, effective, and efficient, and to make their transition to the cloud as quick and seamless as possible.”
title: Streamlined Deployment Option Now Available with 3E Essentials

full_content: Updated branding reflects next step in company’s journey to deliver innovative digital financial solutions to world’s leading law firms NEW YORK (January 30, 2024) – Elite, a leading provider of financial management and business operations solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, today unveiled a new brand, logo and visual identity. As a newly independent legal tech company, the refreshed brand reflects Elite’s heightened commitment to delivering cutting-edge digital financial solutions to its customers, bringing together powerful data, advanced insights and intuitive tools – all on one platform – to help the world’s leading law firms drive productivity, innovation and profits for the future. The updated branding includes a new logo crafted as an ambigram, designed to appear symmetrical from left to right while still reading “Elite.” This approach draws a viewer’s eye to the center of the logo, serving as a bold iconic visual metaphor for how Elite’s products sit at the heart of the operational effectiveness of the most successful law firms around the world. Additionally, the Elite brand comes to life visually through the use of a new distinctive deep purple color and vibrant, impactful photography and imagery. “Introducing our new branding is one of the many things we are doing as we continue to focus on getting closer to our customers, delivering new, innovative products and solutions, and driving future business growth,” said Mark Dorman, CEO of Elite. “Building on Elite’s rich heritage and well-established leadership position in the legal tech industry, we want to convey our customer-centric focus and Elite’s ability to be astute, adaptive, and attentive – as we are at the heart of the world’s most successful law firms, accelerating their business and keeping one beat ahead in meeting their business and operational needs.” Elite solutions are the trusted technological foundation for a significant proportion of the world’s largest and most innovative law firms, with a customer base comprising more than three-quarters of the Am Law 200 and four-fifths of the Global 200 law firms. As it looks toward the future, Elite is poised to capitalize on its unique position at the center of its customers’ financial, operational and technological infrastructure, as well as the global legal industry more widely. Building on a seven-decade legacy of market leadership and innovation, Elite became an independent business on June 1, 2023, after the acquisition of a majority stake by global alternative asset management firm TPG. Since then, Elite has launched two new AI-driven product innovations for its 3E and eBillingHub solutions, made a number of appointments to its senior leadership team and announced the relaunch of its global series of VANTAGE learning events in 2024. View our brand launch video here Elite One Beat Ahead.
title: Press Release: Elite Unveils Bold New Brand and Logo

full_content: (December 12, 2023) Elite, a leading provider of financial and practice management solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, has made a number of new appointments to its executive and senior leadership teams. These include two new C-level roles for the business – Chief Customer Officer (Martin Linusson) and Chief Human Resources Officer (Michael O’Donnell) – as well as its first Head of Information Security (Jason Gerk). Martin Linusson has been appointed as Elite’s Chief Customer Officer, and will lead its recently combined customer support and professional services teams. He joins Elite after serving as Group Vice President of Global Delivery Services at UKG, overseeing global support for new business bookings, managing global delivery revenue expectations, facilitating over 3,500 new customer activations annually, and managing UKG’s partner business. Martin joined UKG through a merger with Kronos Incorporated, where he held the position of VP of Global Services since 2015. In addition, Michael O’Donnell has joined Elite as its first Chief Human Resources Officer. He is a seasoned HR professional with more than two decades of experience in HR planning, talent engagement, HR operations and leadership development. Michael joins Elite after serving as CHRO of leading software company Khoros, and his prior experience includes HR leadership roles at PowerSchool Group (formerly PeopleAdmin), Blue Health Intelligence, and American Airlines. Finally, Elite has named Jason Gerk as its first-ever Head of Information Security, leading a newly formalized cybersecurity and privacy function. He will work across all of Elite’s critical business functions to further strengthen its cyber capabilities and ensure that Elite continues to provide best-in-class digital security for its customers. With more than 20 years of experience in security and technology, Jason joins Elite from leading security at ASAPP, a SaaS technology company which designs AI software to enable customer contact centers. “Martin, Mike, and Jason have joined Elite at an important time in its history, emerging as a fully independent business in the global legal technology industry,” said Mark Dorman, CEO of Elite. “It is exciting to see that we continue to attract exceptional talent to Elite as we pursue our vision and realize our ambitions. With world-class experience in their respective areas, these key additions to our global senior leadership team will contribute a great deal to our future success.”
title: Elite Adds to Its Executive and Senior Leadership Teams

full_content: Elite, a leading provider of financial and practice management solutions to the world’s most successful law firms, has brought the power of AI and machine learning to eBillingHub, the market-leading e-billing platform, to significantly accelerate the categorization and analysis of rejected invoices. Within the latest version of eBillingHub, users are able to addresses the challenge of non-uniform electronic billing rejections, by leveraging Microsoft® Azure OpenAI technology to automatically categorize rejected invoices. More specifically, law firms can easily and more quickly address rejected invoices through automatic, AI-powered categorization of the reason codes, which can then swiftly be reviewed and addressed by a biller. In addition, an enhanced dashboard is now available within eBillingHub, providing a brand-new visual presentation of the number of rejected invoices in the tracking page. Users can instantly see categorized rejections at-a-glance—both by rejection category and by vendor—and are able to click through and quickly act on the rejected invoices. Taken together, this new AI-powered categorization functionality promises to significantly streamline the e-billing workflow, enabling e-billing teams to quickly address rejections by vendor within a specific category and allowing firms to get paid faster. “We worked directly with customers to solve an important pain-point for their e-billing processes, namely, how to automate and accelerate the handling of larger volumes of rejected invoices,” said Ahad Shafiq, senior product manager for eBillingHub at Elite. “This partnership approach, coupled with the power of AI and machine learning, have provided an innovative solution which further transforms and optimizes the e-billing process.” This is the second AI-based innovation to be unveiled by Elite recently. In August, the company launched a new automated time entry capability for users of its flagship financial and practice management solution 3E, in which generative AI technology from the Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service creates draft timecard narratives with just the click of a button. “This new application of AI within eBillingHub is just the latest example of how we are innovating and pushing the boundaries, in order to reduce administrative tasks and speed up business processes for our customers,” added Elisabet Hardy, head of product at Elite.
title: eBillingHub Harnesses AI to Help Address Rejected Invoices Faster
