It will enable us to take advantage of the rapidly changing technological landscape and operate efficiently and securely whilst better servicing and adding value to our clients.”
title: New Zealand Law Firm Anderson Lloyd Selects 3E

full_content: Elite has released a new on-premises version of 3E® (version 3.1), offering a number of enhancements which improve usability and day-to-day processes for users.Among the key updates included in the 3.1 release of 3E is a new, seamless integration with LawPay, a real-time online payment processing application allowing users’ clients to pay invoices by credit card – saving time and reducing data entry errors, posting date discrepancies and requirements to manage client payment data in separate systems.Other key enhancements in the on-premises version include: (1) the ability to alter the fiscal year start (in response to the UK Tax Period Basis Change), as well as improved rate management capabilities; (2) changes to Proforma Edit to incorporate a new ‘full grid’ for details, introducing additional editable columns that allow users to make changes directly; and (3) support for SQL Server 2022 and Windows Server 2022.
title: New On-prem Version of 3E Released

full_content: As part of a multi-product deal, leading Malaysian law firm Halim Hong & Quek is adopting 3E® and 3E MatterSphere® from Elite, the leading provider of financial and practice management solutions to law firms worldwide.Founded in 2000, Halim Hong & Quek (HHQ) has more than 40 lawyers offering clients a full suite of legal services, with a significant focus on corporate real estate. Through its presence in three major cities across Malaysia—Kuala Lumpur, Johor Bahru, and Penang—HHQ represents clients from around the world in complex transactions and high-stakes litigation. HHQ is also a member firm of Andersen Global, an association of legally separate, independent member firms with more than 13,000 professionals in more than 170 countries and 390 locations.Elite offers a suite of solutions—including 3E, ProLaw®, eBillingHub®, and MatterSphere—aimed at improving law firm finance and accounting operations such as billing, invoicing, payments, and financial reporting. For HHQ, the deployment of 3E provides a highly flexible, but immensely powerful, technological foundation to support the acceleration of its business.More specifically, the firm will benefit from a reduction in the time between completing client work and receiving payment, improving cash flow, and enabling even faster growth. In addition, the firm’s significant real estate practice will benefit from the robust automation capabilities available in MatterSphere, enabling lower costs and an even better experience for clients.“As a firm on a fast-growth trajectory which caters to a growing global market, we recognized the necessity for a robust technological infrastructure that could meet our future needs,” said Dato’ Quek Ngee Meng, Managing Partner at HHQ. "In this regard, 3E is an ideal solution as it offers remarkable adaptability and will continue to progress alongside our evolving requirements to provide our clients with a seamless experience."
title: Malaysian Law Firm Halim Hong & Quek Adopts 3E and MatterSphere

full_content: Ohio-based law firm Graham Law was an early adopter of ProLaw, the law practice management and finance software from Elite. It first implemented the solution in the late 1990s. Lawyers, paralegals, administrative, and accounting staff now use ProLaw for a wide range of office requirements, including case management, cost recovery, docketing, and time entry. Today, the firm — which specializes in personal injury and comprises workers’ compensation, disability, criminal defense, and trusts and estates practices — is still finding new ways to use ProLaw to underpin success. Why Graham Law uses ProLaw Transparent case management and cohesive functionality are two of the most significant benefits to the firm. "It's our main case management software. Everyone uses it every day: our attorneys, our paralegals, our accountant, our support staff," says Wendy Ashby, Administrative Assistant. She added, “One of the biggest attractions was that the front-office and back-office functionality work together. You don’t need a separate back-office accounting system from the case management side." Q&A with Wendy Ashby, Administrative Assistant at Graham Law What was the appeal of ProLaw? Wendy says, "We could find all of the cases in one place and see what each other were doing. There would be less repetition – everyone could use the same forms and templates, and we’d be able to easily track what was going on in each case. Plus, it would streamline processes." What are the top 3 aspects of ProLaw for your firm? According to Wendy, “The case management, time entry, and cost recovery capabilities of ProLaw are extremely important. “Attorneys like the fact that they can pull up documents quickly and make changes, or if they are new to a case, they can easily see what progress has already happened so far and get up to speed quickly. They can also enter their time as they go along and keep track of their hours on each matter in a straightforward manner. “When it comes to tracking fees that a department or attorney has brought in, ProLaw makes it easy to retrieve this information. Individuals and the firm can see where we stand against goals for the year and how well we’re recovering costs.” What else do you like about ProLaw? Wendy: “In recent years we’ve started to use it more for marketing. For example, we created a custom tab in contacts to store information about how new clients found out about the firm, and the contacts database provides a vital source of information for following up on leads. We’ve built up a lot of client information in ProLaw over the last 25 years, and we want to make use of that data in our marketing. “Using ProLaw has created efficiencies by removing the duplication of effort and making processes faster. For example, adjusting how expenses or receivables are managed on the accounting side, or eliminating the need to send emails and save documents separately on the case management side because it integrates with Microsoft Outlook and Word and so on. And if an attorney goes to a conference and they learn of a new form, we can put it in ProLaw so everyone can use it."
title: Graham Law’s Lasting Relationship with ProLaw

full_content: Elite, a leading provider of financial and practice management solutions to law firms, has today announced the return of its flagship VANTAGE events for customers and partners.The three major VANTAGE events taking place in 2024 will be: • VANTAGE North America—the first since 2019—which will be held at the luxurious Wynn Las Vegas on May 13-15, 2024 • VANTAGE London, which will be at the Park Plaza Riverbank on March 6, 2024 • VANTAGE Sydney, taking place in March 2024 (date and location to be announced in November)VANTAGE is a series of leading industry events designed to bring Elite clients, partners, and employees together for a time of learning, networking, and fun. Educational sessions, hands-on training, and a dedicated Learning Zone provide ample opportunity for attendees to gain deeper knowledge about the Elite products that they use—including 3E, ProLaw, eBillingHub and MatterSphere—as well as complementary solutions and services available.In addition, a bustling Expo Hall will be dedicated to Elite’s worldwide partner ecosystem, a critical component of its connected ecosystem. Elite’s partner network includes dozens of experienced technology, services, and consulting organizations with offerings that complement Elite’s legal and professional services solutions."We are excited to announce the return of VANTAGE where we can bring customers together to network and learn from each other and Elite’s team of talented experts as well as our critical network of trusted partners,” said Mark Dorman, CEO of Elite. “Creating such opportunities has always been a hallmark of Elite, ensuring our customers can connect with each other and the broader market, taking full advantage of their Elite solutions to drive their firms forward. At VANTAGE, it will enable us to demonstrate how we are applying the latest technologies to help our customers be more profitable, effective and efficient. We are thrilled to revive these highly attended events in 2024 after many customer requests to do so."Further event details for the VANTAGE North American Conference, including the conference agenda and registration information, will be made available on November 8th on the Elite website. Details for the EMEA and APAC events will be available on the Elite website by November 30th.
title: VANTAGE User Conferences Return in 2024

full_content: In order to drive its business to the next level in terms of flexibility, security, and profitability, Top 200 UK law firm Lee & Thompson is adopting 3E, the industry-leading, cloud-based enterprise business management solution from Elite.Founded in 1983, Lee & Thompson is one of the UK’s leading law firms for the media, technology, and creative industries. The firm advises both talented individuals and innovative businesses, counting international media organizations, major brands, rights owners, production companies, design houses, record labels, media and tech entrepreneurs, and many of the world’s most successful creative talents among its clients.Lee & Thompson sought a new, more flexible, and more resilient practice management solution to support the firm’s evolution toward hybrid working in a secure, seamless, and truly unified way. This meant bringing together business functions and processes—like accounting, file opening, time capture, matter management, WIP management, billing, expenses and disbursements, credit control, reporting, group/firm budgeting and forecasting, and process automation—all in one place and based flexibly and securely in the cloud.By choosing 3E, Lee & Thompson will be supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform and offering cloud confidence with nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry.“The approach that Elite has with 3E is clearly the best one for firms like us, allowing firms at a smaller level to benefit from being on the same platform that the most successful firms in the UK and the world are currently on,” said Simon Boyden, Chief Financial & Operations Officer at Lee & Thompson. “Aside from ensuring we are always up to date, 3E will have a transformative impact on our operational excellence, allowing more accurate time recording, enhancing our matter management, improving the visibility of profitability metrics, and speeding up our work-to-cash cycle. Ultimately this will enable us to focus on delivering a superior client experience.”“It was essential for us to ensure that any platform to which we were moving was a true cloud solution and was extremely resilient and secure,” commented the firm’s Head of IT Rob Hilton. “We are confident that 3E Cloud represents a vastly superior choice in terms of cloud architecture. Its adoption will put our firm on the most robust and secure platform in the legal industry—both now and in the future.”“3E has always been known in the industry as the solution of choice for larger law firms, therefore it is refreshing that an independent firm like L&T is now able to benefit from the same functionality through 3E,” added Head of Finance Martin Hare.
title: UK Top 200 Firm Lee & Thompson Chooses 3E

full_content: Transforming how it runs its business, leading U.S. law firm Parker, Hudson, Rainer & Dobbs LLP (Parker Hudson) has successfully adopted 3E® Cloud, the industry-leading law firm management software solution from Elite, as its foundational technology platform for the future.Parker Hudson is a mid-sized U.S. firm with an integrated collection of exceptional boutique practices in alternative dispute resolution, bankruptcy and creditors’ rights, commercial finance, corporate and M&A, healthcare, litigation, real estate, and tax. The firm has more than 70 lawyers serving clients from its offices in Atlanta, Georgia, and Tallahassee, Florida. Parker Hudson is also a member of Meritas, the international association of 182 full-service law firms from more than 90 countries.The firm’s deployment of 3E Cloud has played a key role in modernizing and improving its financial accounting, workflow processes, and reporting. As a result, the firm is already benefiting from a range of powerful automated workflows and configuration options available in the solution.By adopting 3E Cloud, Parker Hudson is now supported by a fully managed service provided by Elite, powered by the Microsoft® Azure® platform. Taken together, 3E Cloud offers nearly unlimited scale, 24/7 monitoring, and advanced security that is unmatched in the industry.“3E Cloud is a fantastic law firm management solution. It’s a powerful product with the flexibility and speed we need today, and it will accommodate our future growth.” Shawn Hardister CFO of Parker Hudson
title: Parker Hudson Goes Live on 3E Cloud

full_content: See why ProLaw was selected to modernize their financial accounting and improve their internal workflowsAiming to take its technological foundations to the next level, U.S. law firm Murphy & Grantland P.A. will be adopting ProLaw®, the business management technology solution designed for small to mid-size law firms. The firm also has purchased eBillingHub® as part of the multi-product deal.Since its founding in 1997, Murphy & Grantland has been singularly focused on providing the highest quality of legal services with uncompromising integrity and uncommon value. Based in Columbia, South Carolina, and with a team of 27 attorneys and growing, the firm supports clients across the state with the full range of their legal needs.In selecting the market-leading finance and practice management solution from Elite, Murphy & Grantland was drawn to the powerful capability of ProLaw to bring together all aspects of the firm within a single, unified system and user-friendly interface. In a single location, the firm now has immediate access to documents, case details, billing history, invoicing status, and a comprehensive contact database, as well as a range of other critical business, financial, and matter information and powerful analytics tools and reports.As part of its technological upgrade, the firm also will be adopting eBillingHub, the pioneer and leading electronic billing solution from Elite designed specifically for law firms, to transform (and further digitize) its billing processes. In addition to seamlessly integrating with ProLaw, eBillingHub will enable the firm to access a robust rules capability based on the industry’s most robust database of corporate legal billing guidelines. The system contains more than 16,000 discrete billing rules from more than 7,000 corporate legal departments, helping to reduce errors and speed payments.
title: Murphy & Grantland Ties Everything Together with ProLaw
